content: Do we have a truncated Fin (n+1) where addition and multiplication are capped off at n? For example, in Fin 5, we would have 2 * 3 = 4 and 3 * 3 = 4 (because the results are both too big)
I seem to recall from @Yaël Dillies that this is useful in combinatorics
It never was useful enough that I defined it
